ref: 7647 paṅgú ʻ lame, crippled in legs ʼ AVPar., Yājñ. 2. *pēṅga -- . 3. *phēṅgu -- . [Variant forms suggest non -- Aryan origin (PMWS 87 with further reference to vaṅkú -- ← Mu., T. Burrow BSOAS xii 382 ← Drav.). Cf. phakka -- m. ʻ cripple ʼ lex., Pa. pakkha -- ʻ crippled ʼ. But this perh. belongs to a group of more generally ʻ defective ʼ words, cf. *paggala -- ]
M. pãgū ʻ lame ʼ, pã̄gā ʻ crippled, limping, bowlegged ʼ.
